docs.text: ok , let's get one thing straight right away : maximum risk is no battleship potemkin ( although it does have some russians in it ! ) , but it's not too bad , really .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's the new film from ringo lam , the latest hong kong filmmaker to defect to hollywood , and stars that minor league schwartzeneggar from belgium , jean-claude van damme ( who , you will recall , also starred in john woo's maiden hollywood effort , hard target ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in lam's film , van damme plays alain moreau , a french cop ( at least his accent makes more sense here than it did in hard target ) who discovers that he was separated shortly after birth from a twin brother who was adopted by russians .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these russians defected to the united states and moved into a black neighbourhood in new york ( where , i suppose , they thought they wouldn't be noticed ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this brother , mikhail suverov ( played in his few scenes by . . . well ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you know ) , becomes deeply involved in the russian mafia and the fbi ( almost the same thing , i guess ) , and is killed in france ( in the movie , things happen so fast that you don't have too much time to think about how weird this all is ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: moreau does what any good surviving twin brother would do and goes to new york to find out why mikhail was killed , and why everyone in france who knows anything about him is also being killed ( we wonder the same thing ; i still do ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in little odessa , he meets mikhail's girlfriend , alex ( natasha henstridge , last seen in species ) , who helps him solve the mystery and adds immeasurably to the mise-en-scene ( she has very nice breasts , and we get to seen them briefly in this movie ; it was rated r in the us but is pg here , so they must have seen more of her breasts than we do ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film lacks the gloss and high production values of such other action movies as broken arrow , the fugitive , hard target , or anything starring arnold , but that works to its benefit , i think .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after all , one thing that's been missing from woo's hollywood films is that certain hong kong funkiness that we all know and love ( well , some of us do ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: movies like this shouldn't be too pretentious , and that is part of the problem with some of these other films : they try to be too " big " in terms of special effects and sheer spectacle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maximum risk has its share of car chases and explosions , but they don't overwhelm the movie or detract our attention from the narrative ( not too much , anyway ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the emphasis throughout is on the characters and their interactions ( even if , at times , they don't make a hell of a lot of sense ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , one of the more interesting aspects of the film is a minor character , a rather overeager new york cabbie ( frank van keeken from tv's " kids in the hall " ) , who begins as something of a joke but becomes an important part of the story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , by the time we have come to really get interested in him , he . . . well ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you'll see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie also features some set pieces of the type that we have come to expect from lam and his hong kong compatriots .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one is a fight in a russian sauna , with lots of sweaty , muscular male flesh ( this one will appeal to certain parts of the audience more than others ) , bullets in heads , and vodka .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another , my personal favorite , is a fight in a meat packing house , featuring pig carcasses and a chainsaw .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and even the predictable car chases are more hong kong than hollywood , as they trash those quaint french cafes , vegetable carts , and , well , french people that , we all know in our hearts , deserve trashing just for being so damn quaint .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of course , the movie does have its share of silliness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for example , while beating the crap out of an obnoxious russian thug who obviously deserves what he's getting , alain stops long enough to look at his own reflection in the cracked mirror with which he has been whacking the guy on the head .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in an unnecessarily dramatic moment , he apparently is shocked at what he sees , at what he has become .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but what has he become ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a tough cop who beats the hell out of a guy who tried to kill him ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: doesn't sound too unreasonable to me , considering the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but let's face it , any time van damme tries to be dramatic , he looks silly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so maximum risk is a little different from most other action films .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while watching it , i was surprised , and a little disappointed , in the relative lack of pyrotechnics .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but watching some of these other action films is sort of like experiencing a sugar rush ; after the initial excitement , there's not much left .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it's short on spectacle , lam's film leaves a better and more lasting impression , i think .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'm more impressed by it now than i was while watching it , and to me , that's a good sign .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: go see maximum risk , but don't expect a typical hollywood action movie ; expect a sort of funky hong kong-hollywood action movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.text: see it twice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dr t . white teaches film at the english language and literature department of the national university of singapore , but we don't hold this against him .
docs.label: positive
